alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 1:21PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Ulster and northwestern Dutchess Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 121 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Port Ewen, or near Kingston, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kingston, Rhinebeck, Hurley, Red Hook, Lake Katrine, Staatsburg, Port Ewen, Esopus, Milan, Rolling Meadows, Norrie Heights, Maple Hill, Linden Acres, Hillside, Fraleighs, Eighmyville, Lafayetteville, Kallops Corners, Union Center and Ponck Hockie. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east central New York.
